title: A Reverse Mamba Attention Network for Pathological Liver Segmentation
author: Jun Zeng (Chongqing University of Posts and Telecommunications), Ulas Bagci (Northwestern University), Debesh Jha (University of South Dakota), ...
relevance_why: The integration of attention mechanisms in the proposed architecture could inform methods in audio segmentation and enhancement tasks, where precise delineation of features is crucial.
background: Pathological liver segmentation involves accurately identifying and delineating liver tissues in medical images, which is essential for diagnosis and treatment planning.
contribution: This paper introduces the Reverse Mamba Attention module to solve the issue of capturing long-range dependencies in images while maintaining local feature accuracy, achieving state-of-the-art performance in liver segmentation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing segmentation methods often struggle with long-range dependencies due to computational limitations and feature loss.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating a dual-mechanism approach that combines hierarchical processing with targeted feature refinement.

key_innovation: The architecture uniquely blends a selective scanning mechanism with reverse attention capabilities, allowing effective boundary delineation in medical imaging.
real_world_impact: This technique could significantly enhance the accuracy and efficiency of liver disease diagnosis and monitoring, potentially improving patient outcomes.

new_terms.reverse attention: **Reverse attention** refers to an attention mechanism that enhances boundary detection by focusing on the surrounding contextual information during image processing.
new_terms.reverse mamba attention: **Reverse Mamba Attention** is a novel approach combining selective scanning with reverse attention principles for improved segmentation in medical imaging.

open_sourcing: The source code of the proposed RMA-Mamba is available at https://github.com/JunZengz/RMAMamba
